Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋「プレシャスツール」
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: 道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・道具屋
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Item Shop

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: コラ！ ガジュマが 人の家で何をしとるか！ さっさと出て行け、ドロボーめ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, what do you think you're doing here, Gajuma!? Get outta here, you thief!

Entry.JapaneseText: ふん、うちに何の用だ……？ 客か……？
Entry.EnglishText: Hmph... What do you want from me? Don't tell me you're a customer...

Entry.JapaneseText: はい、いらっしゃい。 何にするかね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hi, welcome! What can I do for you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> 道具を買う 世間話をする やめる
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Buy Items Talk Cancel

Entry.JapaneseText: 用がないならさっさと 出て行くんだな。
Entry.EnglishText: If you're not buying anything, then get the hell out.

Entry.JapaneseText: はい、まいど。 またよろしくな。
Entry.EnglishText: Thank you! Please come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: はいよ、またな。
Entry.EnglishText: Here you go. Come again!

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、ガジュマが人の家を 勝手にうろつくんじゃない！ すぐに出て行け！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, don't go loitering here, Gajuma! Leave!

Entry.JapaneseText: おい、ガジュマなんぞを 連れて、この街を歩くな！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey, don't go walking around town with a Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: 召使いのガジュマなら、 物置にでも突っ込んどけ！
Entry.EnglishText: If that Gajuma is your servant, then you should shove him in your storeroom instead!

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえさんたち…… この街の者じゃないな。 だが、ヒューマなら大歓迎だ。
Entry.EnglishText: You're out-of-towners, aren't you? Well, if you're Huma, you're welcome here.

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスは大昔、ヒューマが 知恵と技術をもって開拓した ヒューマの街なんだ……
Entry.EnglishText: A long time ago, we Huma used our wisdom and technology to develop Belsas into the town it is today.

Entry.JapaneseText: だから、スカラベさんが ガジュマを追い出したのは 当然なんだよ……
Entry.EnglishText: That's why Lord Scarabe kicking the Gajuma out of town was a no-brainer...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマめ！ とっとと出て行け！
Entry.EnglishText: Get the hell out of here, Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマならヒューマらしく、 ガジュマなんかと一緒に 歩いたりするんじゃない！
Entry.EnglishText: If you're a Huma, then you should act like one. You shouldn't be walking around with Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえたちが来てから、 街のガジュマどもの様子が おかしくなった！
Entry.EnglishText: Ever since you lot came here, those Gajuma have started to act strange!

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえたち、 何を企んどるんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: What are you planning?

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマどもが、女王様を連れて スカラベさんのところに行った そうだが……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that those Gajuma took the Queen with them to Scarabe's mansion. but...

Entry.JapaneseText: そっくりさんじゃないのか？ どうやってベルサスのガジュマが 女王様と知り合うんだ？
Entry.EnglishText: That "Queen" has to be a look-alike, right? How would the Gajuma here in Belsas know the Queen?

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは……信じんぞ！ あれが本物の女王様である はずがないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: I... I'm very sure that that girl wasn't the real Queen! There's no way!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマどもめ、偽者を使って うまい事やりおったな！
Entry.EnglishText: You Gajuma managed to find a very convincing impostor!

Entry.JapaneseText: おまえたち、あの偽者の 女王様を助けたのなら、 スカラベさんも助けてくれ！
Entry.EnglishText: Hey you, if you guys managed to save that impostor, then you have to save Scarabe too!

Entry.JapaneseText: あの人は悪くない…… 悪いのはガジュマだ……
Entry.EnglishText: Scarabe did nothing wrong... It's all those Gajuma's fault!

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍が何と言おうと、 ワシはガジュマなんぞと 協力する気はないぞ！
Entry.EnglishText: What is the Army thinking? I have no intention of ever cooperating with Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと協力するのも、 ガジュマを嫌うのも、 個人の勝手だと思わんか！
Entry.EnglishText: People should be able to decide for themselves whether they want to cooperate with Gajuma or hate them!

Entry.JapaneseText: 嫌う理由などない！ 嫌いだから嫌いなんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't need a reason to hate them! I hate them because I do!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシはとにかく ガジュマが嫌いなんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I hate Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: 理由なんぞ……ない！ なくたって、いいだろうに！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't need a reason to! Who needs one, anyway!

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマと協力するのも、 ガジュマを嫌うのも、 個人の勝手だと思わんか！
Entry.EnglishText: People should be able to decide for themselves whether they want to cooperate with Gajuma or hate them!

Entry.JapaneseText: 嫌う理由などない！ 嫌いだから嫌いなんだ！
Entry.EnglishText: I don't need a reason to hate them! I hate them because I do!

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、寝不足なんだ……！ ああ、眠くてイライラする。
Entry.EnglishText: I haven't been able to sleep recently, it's getting on my nerves!

Entry.JapaneseText: この音のせいだ…… いや、ガジュマのせいだ！
Entry.EnglishText: It's all because of this sound... No! It's because of those Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近、寝不足なんだ……！ ああ、眠くてイライラする。
Entry.EnglishText: I haven't been able to sleep recently, it's getting on my nerves!

Entry.JapaneseText: この音のせいだ…… いや、ガジュマのせいだ！
Entry.EnglishText: It's all because of this sound... No! It's because of those Gajuma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは理由もなく ガジュマが嫌いなんだ…… だが、それでいいのか……？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if it's okay that I hate Gajuma without reason...

Entry.JapaneseText: それを考えるだけで…… 夜も眠れないんだ…… 眠い……眠い……
Entry.EnglishText: That's been keeping me up at night... Oh, I'm so sleepy...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシはヒューマだ…… ガジュマではない…… だが同じ<Yellow>ヒト<White>だ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm a Huma, not a Gajuma... But we're all members of the <Yellow>Human<White> race...

Entry.JapaneseText: 違う理由は何だ…… ではなぜ同じなんだ……？ ワシはもうわからん……眠い……
Entry.EnglishText: Why are both different, yet so similar...? I can't comprehend it... Probably because I'm so tired...

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシはヒューマもガジュマも 同じ<Yellow>ヒト<White>だという前提で 考えてみた……
Entry.EnglishText: I've been thinking that if Huma and Gajuma are fellow <Yellow>Human<White> beings...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Yellow>ヒト<White>は誰ひとり同じ姿の者は おらん……つまり、種族などと いうのはその程度のものなんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Then because no two <Yellow>Human<White> beings look exactly the same... That's all that race comes down to...

Entry.JapaneseText: 姿の違いは個性だ…… 考え方の違いは、話し合う事で 共通点が見つかるはずだ……
Entry.EnglishText: We as individuals are different in appearance... And any differences in the way we think can be discussed so we can find common ground...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマはこの街には 必要ない存在なのだ！ わかったら、出ていけ！
Entry.EnglishText: This town has no need for Gajuma, got it? Now get out!

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベさんはこの街の 英雄的存在なのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Scarabe is regarded as something of a hero here.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの人を悪く言う事は 許さんぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: I won't permit anyone to speak ill of him!

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『グミの棚』 グレープグミ、ライムグミ、 ピーチグミなどが並ぶ棚。 ぷるるんとしていて、ついつい 触りたくなってしまう。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Shelf full of gels - A shelf with Grape Gels, Lime Gels, and Peach Gels on it. You can't help but want to touch them with how they jiggle.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『キャラクター人形』 ウサギのジャンプちゃんと カエルのジャンプくん。 この店のオリジナル商品だが、 現在品切中。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Character Puppets - A display for two puppet characters called Bouncing Bunny and Frolicking Froggy. They are only sold in this store, but right now they're out of stock.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『文房具の棚』 各種文房具が並んでいる。 最近のヒット商品は 「二十面筆入れ」と、 「香りつきネリケシ」。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Shelf of Stationery - There's all sorts of stationery on this shelf. Current best-sellers are the "20-sided Pencil Case" and "Scented Kneaded Erasers."

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ボトルの棚』 棚に並んでいるのはボトルの見本品。 実はお酒が入っていて、ここの主人が 仕事中にコッソリ飲んでいる。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Shelf of Bottles - This shelf displays sample bottles. There's actually alcohol inside of them, and the owner likes to drink out of them while he's working.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『おみやげ用のクツと服』 旅の記念に、なんとなく買ってしまうが、 これをもらっても、なかなか普段着には できない……のが哀しい。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Souvenir Clothes and Shoes - These can be bought as souvenirs, but regrettably don't make good everyday clothes...

Entry.JapaneseText:
<speed:0>『ベルサスポスター』 スカラベのアップがでかでかと 描かれたなんとも言えない商品。
スージーのポスターもあったが完売。
スカラベのポスターの方は 九割引のセール品だが、まだ在庫多数。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Belsas Poster - A poster with a close up of Scarabe's face... there are no words to describe it. It's currently on sale for 90% off, but there's still a lot left. There also used to be posters of Susie, but those have all sold out.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ドリアングミの標本（非売品）』 かつて発売されたドリアングミの標本。 これを食べると、バイラスが全く 寄りつかなくなるという品物。 しかし、一度食べたらその強烈な香りが 一週間もの間、取れない事が災いし、 市場から姿を消した。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Durian Gel Samples (Not For Sale) - Samples of Durian Gels which were formerly sold here. Eating one would keep Biruses away from you, at the cost of having incredibly foul smelling breath that lasted a whole week. And so, they were pulled from the market.
